events.originalText: WikiLeaks published 75,000 classified documents about the War in Afghanistan in one of the largest leaks in U.S. military history.
events.subtitle: WikiLeaks
events.headline: WikiLeaks publishes 75,000 classified documents on War in Afghanistan

events.originalText: Pratibha Patil (pictured) was sworn in as the first female president of India.
events.subtitle: Pratibha Patil
events.headline: Pratibha Patil sworn in as first female president of India

events.originalText: Air France Flight 4590, a Concorde en route from Paris to New York, crashed in Gonesse, France, killing all 109 passengers on board and four people on the ground.
events.subtitle: Air France Flight 4590
events.headline: Air France Flight 4590 crashes in Gonesse, France, killing 109 passengers

events.originalText: The orbiting spacecraft Viking 1 took a photograph of an apparent face on Mars in a classic example of pareidolia.
events.subtitle: Viking 1
events.headline: Viking 1 spacecraft captures photo of face on Mars

events.originalText: Bob Dylan, who had previously been known for folk music, gave a controversial performance at the Newport Folk Festival playing songs with an electric guitar.
events.subtitle: Bob Dylan
events.headline: Bob Dylan's controversial electric guitar performance at Newport Folk Festival

events.originalText: Korean War: After American troops withdrew, North Korean forces captured the village of Yongdong in South Korea.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: North Korean forces capture village of Yongdong in South Korea

events.originalText: Australia (captain pictured) set a world record for the highest successful run-chase in Test cricket history during the Fourth Test of the Ashes series against England.
events.subtitle: Australia national cricket team
events.headline: Australia sets world record for highest successful run-chase in Test cricket history

events.originalText: Spanish–American War: After more than two months of sea-based bombardment, the United States invaded Puerto Rico.
events.subtitle: Spanish–American War
events.headline: United States invades Puerto Rico after sea-based bombardment

events.originalText: The Corinth Canal was formally opened, bisecting the narrow Isthmus of Corinth in Greece to connect the Ionian Sea's Gulf of Corinth with the Aegean Sea's Saronic Gulf.
events.subtitle: Corinth Canal
events.headline: Corinth Canal formally opened in Greece

events.originalText: Mozart completed his Symphony No. 40, one of his two extant minor-key symphonies.
events.subtitle: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
events.headline: Mozart completes Symphony No. 40

events.originalText: Eighty Years' War: Dutch and English forces relieved the siege of Knodsenburg in the Spanish Netherlands, having defeated the Duke of Parma's army in the field.
events.subtitle: Eighty Years' War
events.headline: Dutch and English forces relieve siege of Knodsenburg in Spanish Netherlands

events.originalText: Henry II was crowned King of France at Reims Cathedral.
events.subtitle: Henry II of France
events.headline: Henry II crowned King of France at Reims Cathedral

events.originalText: Nicaean–Latin wars: Alexios Strategopoulos led Nicaean forces to recapture Constantinople, leading to the reestablishment of the Byzantine Empire and the end of the Latin Empire.
events.subtitle: Nicaean–Latin wars
events.headline: Nicaean forces recapture Constantinople, ending Latin Empire

events.originalText: Constantine the Great was proclaimed Roman emperor by his troops after the death of Constantius Chlorus.
events.subtitle: Constantine the Great
events.headline: Constantine the Great proclaimed Roman emperor
